Package edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan

Class Player

java.lang.Object
edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to keep track of the player's cards, color, and victory points

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Player​(PlayerColor color)
    The sole constructor for the player class, takes in the color to assign to this player, initializes victoryPoints to 0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addDevelopmentCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.DevelopmentCardType cardType)
    Adds a given development card to the player's hand
    void addLargestArmy()
    Gives this player the largest army card, adding +2 to the player's victory points.
    void addLongestRoad()
    Gives this player the longest road card, adding +2 to the player's victory points.
    void addResourceCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.ResourceCardType cardType)
    Adds a given progress card to the player's hand
    void addVictoryPoints​(int points)
    Adds victory points to this player's victory points total
    int getNumDevelopmentCards()
    Gets the number of development cards this player has
    int getNumResourceCards()
    Gets the number of resource cards this player has
    PlayerColor getPlayerColor()
    Gets the color of this player
    int getVictoryPoints()
    Gets the number of victory points this player has accumulated
    boolean hasLargestArmy()
    Checks if the player has the largest army card
    boolean hasLongestRoad()
    Checks if the player has the longest road card
    boolean removeDevelopmentCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.DevelopmentCardType cardType)
    Removes a given development card from the player's hand, returns to indicate if the removal was successful
    void removeLargestArmy()
    Removes the largest army card from this player's hand, removing 2 victory points.
    void removeLongestRoad()
    Removes the longest road card from this player's hand, removing 2 victory points.
    ResourceCard removeRandomCard()
    Removes a random resource card from the player's hand, returns the card that was removed

    Removes a given resource card from the player's hand, returns to indicate if the removal was successful

    Checks to see if a player can afford a city, and optionally removes them.

    Checks to see if a player can afford a road, and optionally removes them.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(PlayerColor color)
      The sole constructor for the player class, takes in the color to assign to this player, initializes victoryPoints to 0
      Parameters:
      color - this player's color

  • Method Details

    • addResourceCard

      public void addResourceCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.ResourceCardType cardType)
      Adds a given progress card to the player's hand
      Parameters:
      cardType - the type of progress card to add

    • addDevelopmentCard

      public void addDevelopmentCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.DevelopmentCardType cardType)
      Adds a given development card to the player's hand
      Parameters:
      cardType - the type of development card to add

    • addLongestRoad

      public void addLongestRoad()
      Gives this player the longest road card, adding +2 to the player's victory points. If the player already has the card, then nothing happens.

    • addLargestArmy

      public void addLargestArmy()
      Gives this player the largest army card, adding +2 to the player's victory points. If the player already has the card, then nothing happens.

    • addVictoryPoints

      public void addVictoryPoints​(int points)
      Adds victory points to this player's victory points total
      Parameters:
      points - the number of points to add

    • tryBuyRoad

      public java.lang.Boolean tryBuyRoad​(boolean actuallyRemoveResources)
      Checks to see if a player can afford a road, and optionally removes them.
      Parameters:
      actuallyRemoveResources - Whether to actually remove resources or not
      Returns:
      Returns true if the player can afford a road, and false if not.

    • tryBuySettlement

      public boolean tryBuySettlement​(boolean actuallyRemoveResources)
      Checks to see if a player can afford a settlement, and optionally removes them.
      Parameters:
      actuallyRemoveResources - Whether to actually remove resources or not
      Returns:
      Returns true if player can afford a settlement, and false if not.

    • tryBuyCity

      public boolean tryBuyCity​(boolean actuallyRemoveResources)
      Checks to see if a player can afford a city, and optionally removes them.
      Parameters:
      actuallyRemoveResources - Whether to actually remove resources or not
      Returns:
      Returns true if player can afford a city, and false if not.

    • removeResourceCard

      public boolean removeResourceCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.ResourceCardType cardType)
      Removes a given resource card from the player's hand, returns to indicate if the removal was successful
      Parameters:
      cardType - the type of resource card to remove
      Returns:
      true if the card was successfully removed, false otherwise

    • removeDevelopmentCard

      public boolean removeDevelopmentCard​(edu.rpi.cs.csci4960.s21.javatan.DevelopmentCardType cardType)
      Removes a given development card from the player's hand, returns to indicate if the removal was successful
      Parameters:
      cardType - the type of development card to remove
      Returns:
      true if the card was successfully removed, false otherwise

    • removeRandomCard

      public ResourceCard removeRandomCard()
      Removes a random resource card from the player's hand, returns the card that was removed
      Returns:
      the card that was removed, null if the deck was empty before this function was called

    • removeLongestRoad

      public void removeLongestRoad()
      Removes the longest road card from this player's hand, removing 2 victory points. If the player does not have the card, then nothing happens.

    • removeLargestArmy

      public void removeLargestArmy()
      Removes the largest army card from this player's hand, removing 2 victory points. If the player does not have the card, then nothing happens.

    • hasLongestRoad

      public boolean hasLongestRoad()
      Checks if the player has the longest road card
      Returns:
      true if this player has the longest road card

    • hasLargestArmy

      public boolean hasLargestArmy()
      Checks if the player has the largest army card
      Returns:
      true if this player has the largest army card

    • getVictoryPoints

      public int getVictoryPoints()
      Gets the number of victory points this player has accumulated
      Returns:
      the number of victory points

      public int getNumResourceCards()
      Gets the number of resource cards this player has
      Returns:
      the number of resource cards
